intro: Gomphogyne delavayi, commonly known as the Delavay's gomphogyne, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan and Yunnan in China. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes species known for their aromatic wood and medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
